content: the cosy for the tissue use an empty tissue box to stuff this pattern if you want to ensure that it will survive hard play either wrap the empty tissue box in duct tape to seal it/make it stronger or instead of a cardboard tissue box build your own same-size box from plastic needle point canvas 8 crochet one ice cream cone follow this free pattern https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/melty-the-ice-cream tip do not use safety eyes do not embroider a mouth or eyebrows do not make the added embellishments just make a simple pink ice cream cone 9 crochet one pickle follow this free pattern https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/christmas-pickle-ornament 10 crochet one piece of swiss cheese see below page 7 11 crochet one slice of salami see below page 7 12 crochet one lollipop follow this free pattern https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/lollipop-19 tip the book shows a yellow/blue lollipop banana berry in red heart super saver is this colorway but you can use any variegated yarn you want to make a multicolor lollipop 13 crochet one piece of cherry pie follow this free pattern https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/cherry-pie 14 crochet one sausage see below page 8 15 crochet one cupcake follow this free pattern https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/cupcake-30 tip the book shows a very boring cupcake brown top with a blue bottom i recommend making it with the light blue bottom brown/light brown cake and white icing if you want to add sprinkles and you want this to be as child safe as possible i recommend embroidery or using tulip dimensional puffy fabric paint which is non-toxic and safe and faster than embroidery after you crochet the cupcake you can use the paint to put small sprinkles all over the top of the icing you can also use the fabric paint on the cake and you can use it on the watermelon 16 crochet one slice of watermelon follow this free pattern https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/watermelon-wedge-2 tip you can use black yarn embroidery or black tulip puff paint for the seeds 17 crochet one green leaf see below page 9 18 crochet one butterfly see below page 9-10 page | 3 © 2017 megan lapp all
